channel.title: Docker on Phil Palmer
channel.description: Recent content in Docker on Phil Palmer

item.title: Microarray Expression Analysis
item.description: Built bioinformatics pipeline to automate the discovery differentially expressed genes & pathways from microarray data to be used for a vaccines project with GSK

item.title: DTC support
item.description:
Customer support & bioinformatics pipeline development for Direct To Consumer (DTC) genetics companies such as Sano & Nebula Genomics.

For example, I developed and improved multiple bioinformatics pipelines based on user feedback including: - Dragen - Developed Nextflow pipeline for running Illumina’s Dragen pipeline including indexing, mapping, germline/somatic variant calling & copy number variant (CNV) analysis - Imputation - Benchmarked multiple imputation pipelines - Greatly improved Lifebit’s imputation pipeline by adding input validation & continuous integration testing. This resulted in a highly robust imputation pipeline used in production by direct to consumer genetics companies such as Nebula Genomics and Sano Genetics thousands of times to analyse their customersâ€™ data. - Built imputation RShiny app - Ancestry - Developed Lifebit’s intial Ancestry pipeline

item.title: Drug repurposing & pathway analysis
item.description:
Found drug targets and pathways to accelerate the pharma industry, demoing the results for a pilot with AstraZeneca.

This was for a project for the AI Engine. I built: 1. An RShiny application to visaulise the results of the drug targets 2. A bioinformatics pipeline in Nextflow to automate the discovery of enriched pathways

item.title: Antiviral drug repurposing
item.description:
This side project was done for a PhD application research proposal as a proof of concept

I used differential gene expression analysis & drug repurposing techniques to find compounds with similar gene expression profiles to the HSP90 inhibitor Geldanamycin

item.title: Pharmacogenomics
item.description: Enabled the Benjamin Haibe-Kains (BHK) lab to create more reproducible research by developing a pharmacogenomics Nextflow pipelines to process the GRAY 2013 & 2017 datasets (see one of their most recent papers here for more info)

item.title: ECW Converter
item.description: Dockerised python scripts & Nextflow pipeline for converting the file format of aerial images, developed for the United Nations Department of Statistics

item.title: nf-core/deepvariant
item.description: Google’s DeepVariant variant caller as a Nextflow pipeline (~30 stars on GitHub). Developed as one of the first pipelines as part of the open-source nf-core community to help enable reproducibility within the wider bioinformatics community
